title: Bengaluru failed to tap 80% property tax potential
text: Bengaluru failed to tap 80% property tax potential Bengaluru failed to tap 80% property tax potential The Economic Survey presented on Tues day made an unflattering reference to Bengaluru that it's collecting no more than 5-20% of its total property tax potential. TNN | Feb 1, 2017, 07.24 AM IST (Representative image) BENGALURU: The Economic Survey presented on Tuesday made an unflattering reference to Bengaluru that it's collecting no more than 5-20% of its total property tax potential . The survey gives details of an exercise undertaken to assess the property tax potential of two growing cities -Bengaluru and Jaipur.This means Bengaluru has failed to mop up 80% of its potential revenue . The finance ministry used satellite images from Landsat, and took extracts of building agglomerations and arrived at an aggregate built-up estimate for the city. The tax collection for 2016 has been estimated at Rs 3,151.23 crore. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device. RELATED
